Articles.Content:
Hey guys,

I have a save that originated in 1.0.4 and up to yesterday in 1.2, I was playing ksp and my computer lost power. I booted up my computer into ksp then while loading the game my computer lost power again, fixed the problem of the power issues, i loaded up ksp and was horrified to see that all of my save where gone, i looked in my ksp folder and saw that my save where there, i have tried so many things: also when i speak about world i mean the save game i use almost daily ive put so much into this save.

1,  create new folder in saves folder than paste world data into new folder=fail

2, create world in ksp then drag files from my world into new world= fail

3, backup gamedata (w/ mods) and saves then re install ksp=fail

4, facepalm=fail

5, google for help online and follow instructions=fail

my fear is that this world is corrupt but i really want to play this world.

thank you for your help

for those nerds:) 

processor intel(r) core(tm) i3-4150 CPU @ 3.50ghz 350ghz

ram 16.0gb

64bit windows 10 x64

Usually means your save is corrupted or failing to be parsed by KSP.
Posting a link to your log and the save file in question might help to determine what is wrong with the file.

Edited October 30, 2016 by JPLRepo

okay i will put a link up with my full file i do use mods so it wont work in vanilla but ksp would still detect the save

https://www.dropbox.com/sh/npwgbu1epw0eeh0/AABhC5WfkwSpNqKzWU-SrjGea?dl=0

here is a list of the mods i use

dmagicorbitalscienve

ftp

kerbalengineer (disabled)

landertron

mechjeb (disabled)

mod rocket sys

opm

near future prop

real scale boosters

science relay

syace y exapanded

sstu

tweakscale

warpplugin

thanks for going out of ur way to help me
Okay i have a new problem, now all saves will disapaer after saving and quiting please help asap

So I downloaded your save folder and had a look.

The persistent.sfs file in your download is completely corrupted. There is nothing readable in that file.
Your best bet is to delete this file. Copy and rename your quicksave.sfs to persistent.sfs or copy and rename one of the files in the backup folder (choose the one most relevant).
As to how your file got corrupted... anyones guess. A mod? or KSP was closed/cancelled whilst saving the game? Hard to know.

Edited November 1, 2016 by JPLRepo

So if the persistent.sfs is corrupted doesn't that mean my whole save is gone? and to the fact that my game wont even show any of my save after re downloading ksp im so confused maybe somethings wrong with my pc

34 minutes ago, EvDMonkeyKerbal said:

So if the persistent.sfs is corrupted doesn't that mean my whole save is gone? and to the fact that my game wont even show any of my save after re downloading ksp im so confused maybe somethings wrong with my pc

No there are several backups in your backup folder and there is a quicksave there as well.

Pick the most recent one : persistent (2016_10_29_18_42_54).sfs
Copy that to where the persistent.sfs file is.
Delete the persistent.sfs file.
Rename persistent (2016_10_29_18_42_54).sfs to persistent.sfs
Restart KSP
thanks i will do that tomorrow
